greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest infinite sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => A329697(i) = A329697(j) and A331410(i) = A331410(j) for all i, j >= 1.
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of the ordered pair [A329697(n), A331410(n)].
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 29 2020
